The technique of choice for obstetric analgesia/anaesthesia is peri-medullary anaesthesia, the principles of which were recalled in the chapter on locoregional anaesthesia (figure 5, see [[2C-136-PC-A04]]) ('''[[Prevention of pain associated with care SD-258|prevention of pain associated with care]]''', '''[[Assessment and management of acute pain SD-259|assessment and management of acute pain]]''').

question.title: What is the technique of choice for obstetric analgesia/anaesthesia?
question.description: The technique used to manage pain during childbirth

option_a.title: General anaesthesia
option_a.description: A method that induces unconsciousness and analgesia

option_b.title: Peri-medullary anaesthesia
option_b.description: A technique that targets specific areas around the spinal cord

option_c.title: Epidural anaesthesia
option_c.description: A method that numbs the lower part of the body

option_d.title: Regional anaesthesia
option_d.description: A broader term that includes multiple techniques

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct option
